H0.text: Mid‑ocean ridge is the location where oceans are the deepest.

H1.text: The Abyssal plain is the location where oceans are the deepest.

H2.text: Ocean trench is the location where oceans are the deepest.

H3.text: Volcanic islands are the locations where oceans reach their deepest points.

A4.text: The greatest ocean depth measured is in the Challenger Deep of the Mariana Trench, at a depth of 10,994 m (36,070 ft) below sea level.

A5.text: Here the bottoms of the Marianas and the Tonga–Kermadec trenches are up to 10–11 kilometers (6.2–6.8 mi) below sea level.
